channel.title: Diagnosing IoT Wifi Card
channel.description:
Hello,
Hoping someone will have a suggestion for me in regards to the WL18xx on Legato/Yocto.
This is my current version info
Legato Version: 17.06.0_f83005aa5145d934e8e282fffc8f7f25_modified Firmware Version: SWI9X15Y_07.11.22.00 r33729 CARMD-EV-FRMWR1 2017/01/11 18:04:06 Bootloader Version: SWI9X15Y_07.11.22.00 r33729 CARMD-EV-FRMWR1 2017/01/11 18:04:06 Linux Version: 3.14.29ltsi-a00e464379_3f15cd39ad #2 PREEMPT Mon Feb 20 11:11:17 PST 2017
Following the mangoh docs, I should have high enough versions to support the wl18xx module.
dmesg tells me:
> [ 0.395299] wl18xx board initialization done
however, if I try wifi client scan I get:
> root@fx30:~# wifi client start > successfully called start. > root@fx30:~# wifi client scan > starting scan > DEBUG: le_wifiClient_GetFirstAccessPoint ERROR
logread gives me: [quote] Jan 6 01:20:13 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/daemon T=main | le_wifiClient.c le_wifiClient_Start() 560 | Client starts Jan 6 01:20:13 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/framework T=main | le_wifiClient_server.c Handle_le_wifiClient_Start() 512 | Sending response to client session 0x27d6c : 4 bytes sent Jan 6 01:20:14 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/daemon T=main | le_wifiClient.c CloseSessionEventHandler() 414 | sessionRef 0x27d6c GetFirstSessionRef (nil) Jan 6 01:20:14 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/framework T=main | le_wifiClient_server.c CleanupClientData() 126 | Client 0x27d6c is closed !!! Jan 6 01:20:14 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/framework T=main | le_wifiAp_server.c CleanupClientData() 126 | Client 0x27cdc is closed !!! Jan 6 01:21:47 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/framework T=main | LE_FILENAME ExtractFileDescriptor() 34 | Received fd (11). Jan 6 01:21:47 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/framework T=main | LE_FILENAME ExtractFileDescriptor() 34 | Received fd (15). Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/framework T=main | LE_FILENAME le_mem_ForceAlloc() 841 | Memory pool '.le_wifiClient_ServerData' overflowed. Expanded to 1 blocks. Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/daemon T=main | le_wifiClient.c le_wifiClient_AddNewEventHandler() 508 | Add new event handler Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/framework T=main | le_wifiClient_server.c Handle_le_wifiClient_AddNewEventHandler() 401 | Sending response to client session 0x27cdc : 4 bytes sent Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/daemon T=main | le_wifiClient.c IsScanRunning() 430 | IsScanRunning .0 Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/daemon T=main | le_wifiClient.c le_wifiClient_Scan() 639 | Scan started Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/framework T=main | le_wifiClient_server.c Handle_le_wifiClient_Scan() 598 | Sending response to client session 0x27cdc : 4 bytes sent Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/framework T=WiFi Client Scan Thread | LE_FILENAME PThreadStartRoutine() 362 | Set nice level to 0. Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.info Legato: INFO | wifiService[580]/daemon T=WiFi Client Scan Thread | pa_wifi_client_ti.c pa_wifiClient_Scan() 419 | Scanning Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/daemon T=WiFi Client Scan Thread | le_wifiClient.c MarkAllAccessPointsOld() 317 | Mark all AP as old Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/daemon T=WiFi Client Scan Thread | le_wifiClient.c MarkAllAccessPointsOld() 346 | Marked: 0 Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.info Legato: INFO | wifiService[580]/daemon T=WiFi Client Scan Thread | pa_wifi_client_ti.c pa_wifiClient_GetScanResult() 484 | Scan results Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.info Legato: INFO | wifiService[580]/daemon T=WiFi Client Scan Thread | pa_wifi_client_ti.c pa_wifiClient_GetScanResult() 504 | PARSING:WIFICLIENT_START_SCAN : len:22 Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.err Legato: =ERR= | wifiService[580] | command failed: No such device (-19) Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/daemon T=WiFi Client Scan Thread | le_wifiClient.c ScanThreadDestructor() 395 | Scan thread exited. Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/daemon T=WiFi Client Scan Thread | le_wifiClient.c PaEventHandler() 118 | Event: 2 Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/daemon T=main | le_wifiClient.c FirstLayerWifiClientEventHandler() 452 | Event: 2 Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/framework T=main | le_wifiClient_server.c AsyncResponse_le_wifiClient_AddNewEventHandler() 326 | Sending message to client session 0x27cdc : 8 bytes sent Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/daemon T=main | le_wifiClient.c IsScanRunning() 430 | IsScanRunning .0 Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/daemon T=main | le_wifiClient.c le_wifiClient_GetFirstAccessPoint() 681 | Get first AP Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/daemon T=main | le_wifiClient.c le_wifiClient_GetFirstAccessPoint() 700 | AP not found Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/framework T=main | le_wifiClient_server.c Handle_le_wifiClient_GetFirstAccessPoint() 641 | Sending response to client session 0x27cdc : 4 bytes sent Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.err Legato: =ERR= | wifi[5022]/wifi T=main | wifi_client.c WifiReadScanResults() 123 | le_wifiClient_GetFirstAccessPoint ERROR Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/daemon T=main | le_wifiClient.c le_wifiClient_RemoveNewEventHandler() 538 | Remove event handler Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/framework T=main | le_wifiClient_server.c Handle_le_wifiClient_RemoveNewEventHandler() 466 | Sending response to client session 0x27cdc : 0 bytes sent Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/daemon T=main | le_wifiClient.c CloseSessionEventHandler() 414 | sessionRef 0x27cdc GetFirstSessionRef 0x27cdc Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/framework T=main | le_wifiClient_server.c CleanupClientData() 126 | Client 0x27cdc is closed !!! Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/framework T=main | le_wifiAp_server.c CleanupClientData() 126 | Client 0x27d6c is closed !!! [/quote]
similar logread output if I try to use the legato wifi client api.
Anywhere I can look?

item.title: Diagnosing IoT Wifi Card
item.dc:creator: aelkhabli
item.description:
Hello ,

I also use the FX30, when I update the framework I receive an error to download
Any ideas as to whatâ€™s going on? Thanks you

Best regards,

Read full topic

item.title: Diagnosing IoT Wifi Card
item.dc:creator: ollie
item.description:
Thanks for all your help.

Looks like the last released firmware per https://source.sierrawireless.com/resources/airlink/software_downloads/fx30-firmware/fx30-firmware/ is

Firmware Version: SWI9X15Y_07.11.22.00 r33729 CARMD-EV-FRMWR1 2017/01/11 18:04:06
Bootloader Version: SWI9X15Y_07.11.22.00 r33729 CARMD-EV-FRMWR1 2017/01/11 18:04:06
Linux Version: 3.14.29ltsi-a00e464379_3f15cd39ad #2 PREEMPT Mon Feb 20 11:11:17 PST 2017
FX30 Version: R13.1.2.004

Which is odd considering that per the FX30 datasheet it uses a WP8548-G radio module

Guess its not cross compatible.

Read full topic

item.title: Diagnosing IoT Wifi Card
item.dc:creator: asyal
item.description:
you need to get the proper firmware for FX30 then. I am not sure whether you can simply drop in the standard sierra WP firmware or not.

Read full topic

item.title: Diagnosing IoT Wifi Card
item.dc:creator: asyal
item.description:
ollie:

Attempting to update (Tried 2 different downloads, didnt look like they had a hash publicly avililbe to reference against)

what hardware are you using?

Read full topic

item.title: Diagnosing IoT Wifi Card
item.dc:creator: ollie
item.description:
Thanks for the reply!

Using the spk from https://source.sierrawireless.com/resources/legato/wpx5xxfirmwarerelease14/

Attempting to update (Tried 2 different downloads, didnt look like they had a hash publicly avililbe to reference against)

fwupdate download WPx5xx_Release14_GENERIC_SPK.spk 192.168.2.2
root@192.168.2.2â€™s password:
Connecting to service â€¦
Connecting to service â€¦
Download started â€¦
Error in download

Iâ€™ve tried rolling back my legato version to 16.10, didnâ€™t work with that either.

Read full topic

item.title: Diagnosing IoT Wifi Card
item.dc:creator: asyal
item.description:
There is a mismatch on the legato version and firmware. Can you move to release 14 firmware?

Read full topic

item.title: Diagnosing IoT Wifi Card
item.dc:creator: ollie
item.description:
Hello,

Hoping someone will have a suggestion for me in regards to the WL18xx on Legato/Yocto.

This is my current version info

Legato Version: 17.06.0_f83005aa5145d934e8e282fffc8f7f25_modified
Firmware Version: SWI9X15Y_07.11.22.00 r33729 CARMD-EV-FRMWR1 2017/01/11 18:04:06
Bootloader Version: SWI9X15Y_07.11.22.00 r33729 CARMD-EV-FRMWR1 2017/01/11 18:04:06
Linux Version: 3.14.29ltsi-a00e464379_3f15cd39ad #2 PREEMPT Mon Feb 20 11:11:17 PST 2017

Following the mangoh docs, I should have high enough versions to support the wl18xx module.

dmesg tells me:

[ 0.395299] wl18xx board initialization done

however, if I try wifi client scan I get:

root@fx30:~# wifi client start
successfully called start.
root@fx30:~# wifi client scan
starting scan
DEBUG: le_wifiClient_GetFirstAccessPoint ERROR

logread gives me:

Jan 6 01:20:13 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/daemon T=main | le_wifiClient.c le_wifiClient_Start() 560 | Client starts
Jan 6 01:20:13 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/framework T=main | le_wifiClient_server.c Handle_le_wifiClient_Start() 512 | Sending response to client session 0x27d6c : 4 bytes sent
Jan 6 01:20:14 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/daemon T=main | le_wifiClient.c CloseSessionEventHandler() 414 | sessionRef 0x27d6c GetFirstSessionRef (nil)
Jan 6 01:20:14 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/framework T=main | le_wifiClient_server.c CleanupClientData() 126 | Client 0x27d6c is closed !!!
Jan 6 01:20:14 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/framework T=main | le_wifiAp_server.c CleanupClientData() 126 | Client 0x27cdc is closed !!!
Jan 6 01:21:47 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/framework T=main | LE_FILENAME ExtractFileDescriptor() 34 | Received fd (11).
Jan 6 01:21:47 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/framework T=main | LE_FILENAME ExtractFileDescriptor() 34 | Received fd (15).
Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/framework T=main | LE_FILENAME le_mem_ForceAlloc() 841 | Memory pool â€˜.le_wifiClient_ServerDataâ€™ overflowed. Expanded to 1 blocks.
Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/daemon T=main | le_wifiClient.c le_wifiClient_AddNewEventHandler() 508 | Add new event handler
Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/framework T=main | le_wifiClient_server.c Handle_le_wifiClient_AddNewEventHandler() 401 | Sending response to client session 0x27cdc : 4 bytes sent
Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/daemon T=main | le_wifiClient.c IsScanRunning() 430 | IsScanRunning .0
Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/daemon T=main | le_wifiClient.c le_wifiClient_Scan() 639 | Scan started
Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/framework T=main | le_wifiClient_server.c Handle_le_wifiClient_Scan() 598 | Sending response to client session 0x27cdc : 4 bytes sent
Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/framework T=WiFi Client Scan Thread | LE_FILENAME PThreadStartRoutine() 362 | Set nice level to 0.
Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.info Legato: INFO | wifiService[580]/daemon T=WiFi Client Scan Thread | pa_wifi_client_ti.c pa_wifiClient_Scan() 419 | Scanning
Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/daemon T=WiFi Client Scan Thread | le_wifiClient.c MarkAllAccessPointsOld() 317 | Mark all AP as old
Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/daemon T=WiFi Client Scan Thread | le_wifiClient.c MarkAllAccessPointsOld() 346 | Marked: 0

Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.info Legato: INFO | wifiService[580]/daemon T=WiFi Client Scan Thread | pa_wifi_client_ti.c pa_wifiClient_GetScanResult() 504 | PARSING:WIFICLIENT_START_SCAN : len:22
Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.err Legato: =ERR= | wifiService[580] | command failed: No such device (-19)

Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/framework T=main | le_wifiClient_server.c Handle_le_wifiClient_GetFirstAccessPoint() 641 | Sending response to client session 0x27cdc : 4 bytes sent
Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.err Legato: =ERR= | wifi[5022]/wifi T=main | wifi_client.c WifiReadScanResults() 123 | le_wifiClient_GetFirstAccessPoint ERROR

Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/framework T=main | le_wifiClient_server.c Handle_le_wifiClient_RemoveNewEventHandler() 466 | Sending response to client session 0x27cdc : 0 bytes sent
Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/daemon T=main | le_wifiClient.c CloseSessionEventHandler() 414 | sessionRef 0x27cdc GetFirstSessionRef 0x27cdc
Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/framework T=main | le_wifiClient_server.c CleanupClientData() 126 | Client 0x27cdc is closed !!!
Jan 6 01:21:48 fx30 user.debug Legato: DBUG | wifiService[580]/framework T=main | le_wifiAp_server.c CleanupClientData() 126 | Client 0x27d6c is closed !!!

similar logread output if I try to use the legato wifi client api.

Anywhere I can look?
